New Records: Rohit Sharma scored his 30th T20I fifty
Rohit Sharma hit his 599th and 600th sixes in international cricket
Rohit Sharma went past 4000 runs in T20Is
Rishabh Pant hit three sixes and two fours while scoring an unbeaten 36 off 26
Key Match Events: India won the match by 8 wickets (with 46 balls remaining)
Rohit and Pant helped India cross the line with 46 balls remaining
Kohli fell early, caught on the deep-third boundary while charging at Mark Adair
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma and Rishabh Pant made short work of a target of 97 to get India off to a winning start at the T20 World Cup 2024
India quicks lead demolition of Ireland on fizzing pitch
Miscellaneous Highlights: New York's second match as a T20I venue was a lot like its first: low-scoring and brutal
India's selection was spot-on - they picked four fast bowlers including Hardik Pandya, and two spin-bowling allrounders
The pitch remained treacherous, and Rohit's control percentage hovered in the 40s for most of his innings
The first two overs gave enough of a clue of how this pitch would behave, with both Arshdeep and Siraj extracting inconsistent bounce
Others: Arshdeep Singh, Mohammed Siraj, Jasprit Bumrah and Hardik picked up 8 for 81 between them
Barry McCarthy was caught and bowled by an Axar Patel ball that stuck in the pitch
